title: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
description: A traditional Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and black pepper. Simple ingredients create an incredibly rich and satisfying meal.
ingredients: 1 cup freshly grated Pecorino Romano cheese
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add pancetta and cook until crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
Add minced garlic to the pancetta and cook for another minute until fragrant.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated cheese, and a generous amount of black pepper.
When pasta is done, reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining.
Add hot pasta to the skillet with pancetta and toss to combine.
Remove from heat and quickly add the egg mixture, tossing vigorously to create a creamy sauce.
Add pasta water gradually if needed to achieve desired consistency.
Serve immediately with additional cheese and black pepper.

title: Fluffy Pancakes
description: Light, fluffy pancakes perfect for weekend breakfast. These pancakes are golden brown on the outside and incredibly soft on the inside.
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, beat eggs and then whisk in milk, melted butter, and vanilla.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and stir just until combined. Don't overmix - lumps are okay.
Let batter rest for 5 minutes while you heat the pan.
Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat and add a little butter.
Pour ¼ cup of batter for each pancake onto the hot griddle.
Cook until bubbles form on surface and edges look set, about 2-3 minutes.
Flip and cook until golden brown on the other side, about 1-2 minutes more.
Serve hot with butter and maple syrup.

title: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
description: A fresh and healthy salad packed with Mediterranean flavors. Perfect for meal prep or as a light lunch.
ingredients: 2 cans (15 oz) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
½ cup kalamata olives, pitted and halved
instructions: In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, and olives.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over the chickpea mixture and toss to combine.
Add feta cheese and parsley, gently toss again.
Let salad marinate in refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Classic homemade chocolate chip cookies that are crispy on the edges and chewy in the center. Perfect for any occasion!
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
In a large bowl, cream together softened butter and both sugars until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract.
Gradually mix in the flour mixture until just combined.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 9-11 minutes or until golden brown around the edges.
Cool on baking sheet for 2 minutes before transferring to wire rack.

title: Thai Green Curry
description: Aromatic and flavorful Thai green curry with coconut milk, vegetables, and your choice of protein. Fragrant and satisfying.
instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons of thick coconut cream from the top of the can in a wok over medium heat.
Add green curry paste and fry for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
Add chicken pieces and cook until nearly done, about 5 minutes.
Add remaining coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer.
Add eggplant, bell pepper, and green beans. Simmer for 8-10 minutes.
Add kaffir lime leaves, fish sauce, and palm sugar.
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
Add Thai chili and fresh basil leaves just before serving.
Serve hot over steamed jasmine rice.

title: Caesar Salad
description: Classic Caesar salad with crispy romaine lettuce, homemade croutons, parmesan cheese, and creamy Caesar dressing.
ingredients: ½ cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: For croutons: toss bread cubes with 2 tbsp olive oil and half the minced garlic. Bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes until golden.
In a large bowl, mash remaining garlic and anchovies into a paste with salt.
Whisk in egg yolk, lemon juice, and Dijon mustard.
Slowly drizzle in remaining olive oil while whisking constantly to emulsify.
Add a few dashes of Worcestershire sauce and season with pepper.
Add chopped romaine lettuce and toss to coat with dressing.
Add half the Parmesan cheese and croutons, toss again.
Serve immediately topped with remaining cheese and croutons.
